intro: Hibbertia solanifolia, commonly known as the yellow-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Hibbertia solanifolia is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in full sun.
